title: Stealth Publishing
body:
The 12-story building that serves as headquarters for Unit 61398, China's military cybercommando organization, has joined a handful of taller, more stylish structures in New York and London as the latest center of publishing. Unlike its secular counterparts, however, the enterprise that resides in this locale operates inversely.

While other publishers create and distribute content in outward fashion, using frameworks of taxonomy and process to produce normalized quality, this publisher extracts disparate instances of content from remote stores protected by systems that present varying degrees of permeability.

Those separate pieces are reassembled using different taxonomies and published inward to a small readership of military and economic strategists. Classified information from disparate sources, harvested by any means necessary, now exists as part of a monolithic body of knowledge, curated for purposes far different than those that drove its creation.

This is the most pervasive, most dangerous form of stealth publishing. Unfortunately, it's still in the early stages.
